intro: Stachytarpheta zuccagnii, commonly known as the purpletop verbena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to blue. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1.5 meters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its nectar-rich flowers attract a variety of pollinators, including bees and butterflies.
